Important Articles.headline: REDMOND, Wash (Reuters) -Thousands of people swooned in a dark conference hall that felt more like a rock concert when a Microsoft product manager demonstrated the company's latest feature: how to sum numbers in Excel, with the click of a button.  "It was literally like Mick Jagger walked out," said Yusuf Mehdi, Microsoft's consumer chief marketing officer, who started as an intern.  On Friday, the day Microsoft turned 50, the company's leaders and staff gathered at its headquarters in Redmond, Washington, to remember the software maker's glory days while trumpeting what they hope will bring it into the future: more powerful artificial intelligence.
Important Articles.title: Microsoft, turning 50, dials up Copilot actions to stay in AI game
